intro: Physaria rectipes, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Physaria rectipes is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
